tabs.title: Policies

tabs.tab-4: The complaint processing and dispute handling policy

item-1.title: Privacy Policy
item-1.subTitle: Effective as of: Mar 9, 2023
item-1.paragraph-1: This Privacy Policy describes how Yudaneru collects, uses, and discloses information associated with an identified or identifiable individual (referred to in this Privacy Policy as “Personal Data”) and what choices you have around this activity. If you have any questions, please don’t hesitate to contact us.
item-1.paragraph-2: When we refer to “Yudaneru”, we mean Yudaneru Technologies, LLC or Yudaneru Technologies Limited, as explained in more detail in the “Identifying the Data Controller and Processor” section below.

item-2.title: Solicitation Policy
item-2.subtitle: Pursuant to Article 10 of the Act on the Provision of Financial Services, we have established and publicly announced our solicitation policy for sales of financial products as follows.
item-2.paragraph-1: 1 Basic stance on solicitation (matters to be taken into consideration in light of the knowledge, experience and status of property of the person subject to the solicitation of sales, and the purpose for the conclusion of the contract pertaining to the sale of the financial instruments.)
item-2.paragraph-2: (1) The Company shall endeavor to provide appropriate advice and explanations in light of the customer's knowledge, investment experience, financial situation, and investment objectives.
item-2.paragraph-3: (2) The Company will endeavor to provide advice and explanations based on appropriate methods regarding important matters such as product details, risk details, and commissions in order for clients to trade at their own discretion and responsibility.
item-2.paragraph-4: (3) The Company will not provide customer with definitive judgments or information that is not true.
item-2.paragraph-5: Matters to be taken into consideration for the person subject to the solicitation of sales with regard to the means and timing of solicitation of sales.
item-2.paragraph-6: (1) The Company will endeavor to provide accurate information on financial products, comply with the Financial Instruments and Exchange Law and other related laws and regulations, and conduct appropriate solicitation in accordance with such laws and regulations.
item-2.paragraph-7: (2) The Company will endeavor to conduct solicitation at appropriate times and places in accordance with the wishes and requests of our customer.
item-2.paragraph-8: 2 Matters for ensuring the appropriate solicitation of sales.
item-2.paragraph-9: (1) In order to ensure proper solicitation of clients, the Company shall provide sufficient training to our employees and endeavor to maintain an internal system.
item-2.paragraph-10: (2) The Company shall endeavor to respond in good faith to complaints and requests from customers.

item-3.title: Privacy Policy
item-3.paragraph-1: YUDANERU Corp. (hereinafter referred to as 'YUDANERU') is committed to ensuring compliance with the 'Act on the Protection of Personal Information' and other laws, regulations, and rules related to the protection of Personal Information, including Guideline for the Act on the Protection of Personal Information. We will make this policy known to all of our directors, employees, and anyone else engaged in our business operations, and will strive to protect Personal Information appropriately in accordance with this policy.
item-3.paragraph-2: In the process of providing our services, we will use legal and appropriate means to acquire Personal Information about individual customers and Personal Information about persons related to corporate or group customers to the extent necessary for our business, and will acquire such information to the extent necessary to achieve the following purposes of use.
item-3.paragraph-3: We will use Personal Information only within the scope necessary to achieve the following purposes of use in connection with the following businesses of ours, except as otherwise provided by law.
item-3.list-1: Buying, selling, exchange, lease, owning, and brokerage and management of real estate
item-3.list-3: Sales of trust beneficiary interests in land and buildings, and acting as agent and intermediary for such sales
item-3.list-4: Sales of trust beneficiary interests in the surface rights, and acting as agent and intermediary for such sales
item-3.list-5: Sales of trust beneficiary interests in leasehold rights of land and buildings, and acting as agent and intermediary for such sales
item-3.list-6: Other business that Our Company may engage in (including business that will be permitted to be handled in the future).
item-3.list-7: To ensure the implementation of products, services, etc. related to all businesses conducted by Our Company.
item-3.list-8: To provide with information that will be useful in connection with all of Our Company's business activities.
item-3.paragraphTitle-4: 3. Shared use of customers' Personal Data among group companies
item-3.paragraph-4: We may share your Personal Data with our group companies around the world in order to provide efficient and reliable services and to increase your choice of products and services. When we share your Personal Data, we will be responsible for managing it, and the items of Personal Data shared will be limited to what is necessary for the purpose for which it is shared.
item-3.paragraphTitle-5: Provision of Personal Information to third parties
item-3.paragraph-5: We will not provide Personal Information to third parties except in the following cases
item-3.list-9: When the customer has given consent
item-3.list-11: When the Company provides Personal Information to a subcontractor to the extent necessary for the performance of its business operations. In the event that we outsource the handling of Personal Information to a third party, we will establish criteria for the selection of the outsourced company and conduct necessary and appropriate supervision to ensure that appropriate security control measures are taken by the outsourced company in advance.
item-3.paragraph-6: In handling Personal Information, we take appropriate security control measures and maintain a necessary and appropriate system for the protection of Personal Information.  In addition, we will continuously instruct and educate all employees on the handling of Personal Information protection.
item-3.paragraphTitle-7: Procedures for Disclosure, Correction, Deletion, etc. of Personal Information
item-3.paragraph-7: Upon receiving a request for disclosure, correction, etc. (correction, addition, or deletion), elimination, suspension of use, or suspension of provision to a third party of Personal Information, we will respond appropriately and promptly after confirming the identity of the person making such a request.  In the case of a request by a representative, the 'Request Form for Disclosure of Personal Information' and 'Letter of Proxy' must be submitted to confirm that the request is made by the principal and that the representative has the authority to act on behalf of the principal.  A disclosure fee of 1,000 yen (including consumption tax) will be charged per disclosure. Please contact the '7. Personal Information Consultation Desk' below for specific procedures and other information
item-3.paragraphTitle-8: Contact for Personal Information Consultation, etc.
item-3.paragraph-8: Complaints and questions regarding the Company's handling of Personal Information will be handled appropriately and should be directed to the following contact point.
item-3.paragraph-11: (Hours of operation: weekdays from 10:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m.)
item-3.paragraphTitle-12: (Hours of operation: weekdays from 10:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m.)
item-3.paragraph-12: This policy is subject to revision due to changes in laws and regulations or other reasons.
item-3.paragraph-13: Supplementary Provisions This policy shall come into effect as of May 25, 2015.Revised February 1, 2023
item-3.paragraphStrong: Nam veritatis consequatur est omnis debitis At consequatur earum:

item-4.title: The basic policy against anti-social forces
item-4.paragraph-1: Our Company has established and publicized “Fundamental Policy against Anti-Social Forces” to ensure the safety and fairness of the capital market and the safety of our employees.
item-4.paragraph-2: 1.Our Company shall endeavor to take company-wide actions against anti-social forces.
item-4.paragraph-3: 2.Our Company shall build on-going and close relationships with the external specialized organizations.
item-4.paragraph-4: 3.Our Company shall reject any relationship or transactions with anti-social forces.
item-4.paragraph-3: 4.Our Company shall resolutely reject any unreasonable demand from anti-social forces and take legal actions under civil and criminal codes if necessary.
item-4.paragraph-5: 5.Our Company shall not negotiate any under-the-table deals or provide funds to anti-social forces to resolve any kind of issue.

item-5.title: Complaint and dispute resolution system for our financial instruments business
item-5.paragraph-1: We have established 'Complaint and Dispute Handling Regulations', and we are committed to responding sincerely and promptly to complaints from our customers, etc., and to gain their understanding.
item-5.listTitle-1: The standard flow of complaint resolution by the Company is as follows:
item-5.list-1: Receipt of complaints, etc. from customers
item-5.list-2: Interviews with personnel in charge and consideration of proposed solutions
item-5.list-3: Presenting solutions and resolving the complaint
item-5.paragraph-2: Our consultation service【Consultation on Complaints, etc. Concerning the Financial Instruments Business】
item-5.paragraph-4: (Monday through Friday, 10:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. excluding national holidays)
item-5.paragraph-5: Non-profit organization: Financial Instruments Mediation Assistance Center (FINMAC) for complaint resolution
item-5.paragraph-6: In addition to the above (1), the Company will attempt to resolve complaints through FINMAC.
item-5.paragraph-7: Japan Investment Advisers Association entrusted FINMAC with the complaint resolution business
item-5.paragraph-8: Measures to use FINMAC through individual use registration
item-5.paragraph-9: If you wish to use FINMAC to resolve a complaint with us, please contact the 'FINMAC Consultation Desk' below.
item-5.listTitle-4: The standard flow of steps taken by FINMAC to resolve complaints is as follows:
item-5.list-4: Filing a complaint by a customer
item-5.list-5: Refer the complaint to a member company
item-5.list-6: Discussion and resolution between the customer and the member company
item-5.paragraph-12: (Monday through Friday, 9:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m., excluding national holidays)
item-5.paragraph-14: We seek to resolve disputes through mediation conducted by FINMAC.
item-5.paragraph-16: Business entrusted to FINMAC by the Japan Investment Advisers Association
item-5.paragraph-18: Measures to use FINMAC through individual use registration.
item-5.paragraph-19: Disputes are resolved through mediation procedures by FINMAC's mediation committee members.
item-5.paragraph-20: If you wish to use FINMAC to resolve a dispute with us, please contact the 'FINMAC Consultation Service'.
item-5.paragraph-21: The following is the standard flow for dispute resolution conducted by FINMAC. For more information, please contact FINMAC.
item-5.list-7: Submission of a mediation petition by the customer
item-5.list-8: Receipt of mediation petition and appointment of mediation committee members
item-5.list-9: Payment of the mediation fee by the customer
item-5.list-10: Hearing of the customer and member companies by the mediation committee
item-5.list-11: Presentation and acceptance of mediation proposal
item-5.paragraph-25: (Monday through Friday, 9:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m., excluding national holidays)
item-5.paragraph-26: ※Please be aware that you will be required to provide us or the Financial Instruments Mediation Assistance Center (FINMAC) with your personal information (name, contact information, details of consultation/complaint, etc.) when requesting complaint resolution or dispute resolution.
